language.title: Scopes
language.description: Shows how many objects are stored in all persistent scopes. This does not reflect the size of the data itself yet, only the number of objects is defined.
language.custom: Shows how many elements are across all contexts separated by the scope type.
Shows how many elements are in the specific web contexts.
There is only one server scope for all web contexts.
Object count in the server scope.
There is one application scope for every application context defined in every web context.
Every Application Contxt in every Web Context can have multiple sessions.
Number of scopes defined inside this application context.
Number of elements in this scope (recursive count)
Percentage of all scopes of this type compared to all web contexts.
Element count in all scopes of this type in the application context
Element count of all scopes of this type in all web contexts.
The session scope holds user specific data. Normally there are several sessions per application which should not be too big.
There should mostly be one application scope per web context. It normally contains a huge amount of data.
The server scope is normally not used that often. It is application and context indepenent.
